paragraph.heading:
Dendrobium indragiriense Schltr., Repert.
Spec. Nov. Regni Veg.
9: 164, 1911

subSubSection.paragraph:
Homotypic synonym:
Grastidium indragiriense (Schltr.) Rauschert, Feddes Repert.
94: 450, 1983.

Specimen examined:— TANINTHARYI . Dawei District: fide
Aung et al. (2020: 79)
. Distribution:— Andaman Islands, southern Myanmar , Thailand and western Malesia .

Dendrobium infundibulum
Lindl., J. Proc. Linn. Soc., Bot.
3: 16, 1859. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Lobb s.n.
( holotype : K-LINDL)

Homotypic synonym:
Callista infundibulum (Lindl.) Kuntze, Revis.
Gen . Pl.
2: 655, 1891.

Heterotypic synonyms:
Dendrobium moulmeinense Low ex Bateman, Bot. Mag .
90: t. 5446, 1864, nom. prov. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish s.n.
, imp. & cult.
Low s.n.
(not located)
.

f., Gard. Chron . 1869: 554, 1869.

(Rchb.f.) H.J.
Veitch,
Man. Orchid. Pl.
3: 50, 1888. Type:— MYANMAR . Bago Region : Pyay District , Benson s.n. , cult. Veitch s.n. ( holotype : W-R 32476 )
.

Dendrobium infundibulum Lindl. var. ornatissimum Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron ., n.s., 19: 656, 1883. Type:—ORIGIN UNKNOWN (? Myanmar ). Cult. Wyatt s.n. ( holotype : W-R).

BAGO . Pyay District : type . MON. Mawlamyine District : types ; same loc.,
Parish 130 & 132 A
( K )
;
same loc.,
Parkinson 5134
( K )
;
same loc.,
Lace 6294
( K ). WITHOUT LOCALITY. Without collector s.n. ( AMES )
.
Reported from Magway Region and Kayah , Kayin and Rakhine states by
Kress et al. (2003: 74)
, but we have not seen material from these areas
.
Distribution:— India , Bangladesh , Myanmar , Thailand and Indochina.

Notes:— Seidenfaden (1985: 118) mentioned that E.A. Schelpe considered
D. wattii
conspecific with
D. infundibulum .
One of us, PO, has studied material from Myanmar , and based on this we concur.
Dendrobium wattii
represents the smaller-flowered forms of the species. Most likely, its so-called rarity is due to collectors preferring the larger-flowered forms rather than the smaller-flowered typical variety.
